word: With what firmness and power He uttered these words. The Jews had never before heard such words from human lips, and a convicting influence attended them; for it seemed that divinity flashed through humanity as Jesus said, "I and my Father are one." . . . Jesus looked upon them calmly and unshrinkingly, and said, "Many good works have I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do you stone me?"
